paper_title: A novel method to enhance CSL fraction, tensile properties and work hardening in complex concentrated alloys — Lattice distortion effect

graphs.title: Engineering stress–engineering strain (room temperature, ~10^-3 s^-1)
graphs.description: Fig. 5(a) compares engineering stress–strain curves for multiple Fe-free and Fe-containing CCAs designed to tune lattice distortion.
graphs.about_graph: Dog-bone tensile tests at ~10^-3 s^-1; curves labeled by alloy composition.

curves.curve_description: Quinary, Al-stabilized CCA; moderate strength with large uniform elongation.
curves.about_curve: Cast + homogenized + recrystallized; equiaxed FCC single phase.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Lower UTS and work-hardening than Fe-free CCAs.
curves.what_is_common_between_this_curve_and_ot: Same test temperature/rate and FCC single phase.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.198–0.365.

curves.curve_description: Higher Al than C1; slightly stronger but still below Fe-free set.
curves.about_curve: Recrystallized FCC; increased lattice distortion via Al.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Higher initial yield vs C1; lower ductility than top performers.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.023–0.072.

curves.curve_description: Equiatomic quaternary baseline with Fe; good ductility, lower UTS.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Among the lowest strength in the set.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.177–0.364.

curves.about_curve: FCC; used as comparison for lattice-distortion variants.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Lower strength than the Cr-enriched and Ti/Al-modified Fe-free alloys.
curves.what_is_common_between_this_curve_and_ot: Same specimen preparation and test rate.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.026–0.069.

curves.curve_description: Cr-rich variant; highest UTS and work hardening among Fe-free set.
curves.about_curve: Enhanced lattice distortion via higher Cr.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Shows the highest strength and delayed necking.
curves.what_is_common_between_this_curve_and_ot: Same FCC class; same test conditions.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.171–0.342.

curves.curve_description: Even more Cr; very high strength with good ductility.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Strength comparable to or slightly above C5; late drop at high strain.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.129–0.261.

curves.curve_description: Fe-free with minor Al; strong with extended hardening.
curves.about_curve: Lattice distortion via Al without Fe.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Higher strength than Fe-containing Al-alloys at similar Al level.
curves.what_is_common_between_this_curve_and_ot: FCC single phase; same test conditions.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.173–0.371.

curves.curve_description: Fe-free with minor Ti; strong, high work hardening.
curves.about_curve: Lattice distortion via larger Ti atoms.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Among the stronger Fe-free alloys; good late-strain hardening.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.027–0.078.

graphs.title: True stress–true strain (room temperature, ~10^-3 s^-1)
graphs.description: Fig. 5(b) shows true stress–true strain curves for the same alloy set.
graphs.about_graph: Converted from the same tensile tests as G1; true quantities emphasize work hardening.

curves.curve_description: Lower true flow stress; modest hardening slope.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Sits near the bottom of the true-stress bundle.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.028–0.077.

curves.curve_description: Slightly above C1; still below Fe-free set.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: True stress lower than Fe-free curves across strain.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.020–0.077.

curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Below the Fe-free bundle at higher strain.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.021–0.077.

curves.curve_description: Reference Fe-free ternary; solid work hardening.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Below Cr-enriched Fe-free curves at high strain.
curves.what_is_common_between_this_curve_and_ot: Same test conditions and conversion to true values.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.139–0.241.

curves.curve_description: Among the top curves; highest true stresses by ~0.45–0.5 true strain.
curves.about_curve: Fe-free with raised Cr for stronger lattice distortion.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Peak of the bundle alongside C6.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.028–0.070.

curves.curve_description: Top true-stress performer with sustained hardening.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Highest overall true stress at large strain.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.157–0.260.

curves.curve_description: High true flow stress; extended hardening plateau.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Above Fe-containing Al-alloys over full strain range.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.026–0.073.

curves.curve_description: Strong Fe-free alloy with high true stresses.
curves.about_curve: Minor Ti addition increases lattice distortion.
curves.what_is_different_between_this_curve_and: Near the upper envelope together with Al- and Cr-modified Fe-free alloys.

Kocks\u2013Mecking_hardening_parameters.comment: Parameters obtained by linear regression on θ vs σ in the strain window 0.128–0.242.
